name: XFM London - Uploaded by AirCheckDownload on Mixcloud

transcript.content: Blur - Song Two
Deftones - Be quiet and drive
Blur Song Two before that Deftones Be quiet and drive on. XFN 104. What is it, I've forgotten the frequency?
Oh. Well if only Lorri...
Hold on, here he is! I don't believe it.
Lorri [inaudible] is here?
Yeah he's [inaudible], Lorri what's the frequency?
That's what I thought. 1-0-oh I missed that. What was it? 104 point what?
Oh right yeah that's what I thought. Um, Well, you've got a joke to tell us haven't you?
It seems like every week now we get little gag in. A little - It's great, isn't it? So sort of capital-like this is very penkish.
Yeah.
Is that a verb?
To penk, to be Penk.
Yeah. If only his name was Pank, I could finish my song off. All right. Go on.
Steve Pank.
Leave it come on.
Gervais, you might have read it before.
Go on, read it.
Heard it last night from some fella. Why are London buses red?
Go on.
You'd be red if you had to come every ten minutes. What do you think?
It's great.
It's not bad is it?
No, it's good.
It's a simple little joke.
I like it. Ah.
Play a record, Gervais, because in a minute I want to talk about my perfect murder.
Oh, excellent.
But let's play a record and I'll tell you about my perfect murder. Gervais, if anybody out there who needs to know a perfect murder, perhaps you're thinking of knocking somebody off.

There was actually someone killed near me last night. Seriously. I rang the ambulance and the bloke was there and he's just, like, out there in his underpants and he was dead and he had, like, all sort of, like, whipped cream on his face in, like, hundreds and thousands and apparently he topped himself.
Hurricane Streets Film
Coka-cola
Scope - Song for bobby
Scope song for Bobby on XFM 104.9 just gone 05:00. It's about time for a perfect murder.
Gervais, everybody knows somebody they want to kill. All right? Everybody's thought about it.
We're not actually saying that's a good thing.
Well, no, we're not advocating murder, but we're saying that it is something that crosses people's minds.
Yeah
And if you are tempted to murder somebody, why not...
At least it get it right

At least get it right. Exactly. Now, Gervais, I'm sure you yourself have realized perhaps the reason you haven't committed murder yourself, this could be the reason you don't commit murder, is that, you know, what am I going to do with the, uh, murder weapon?
Yep
That's the stumbling block, you see. If there's a murder weapon, that, you can normally sort of trace, you know, trace the murder weapon back to the murderer.
Yeah
You see the murder weapons a problem, you got to dispose of it, you know, whatever. See, now I have come up with perfect murder, Gervais, all right?
It's simple.

It's so simple, I don't believe other people ever thought of it. What you do is say you want to murder lives in the street opposite, lives in the house opposite say. What you do is you rent a room opposite theirs, all right? You wait until one day their window is open, all right? And then what you do is you take a block of ice, Gervais, ice all right? And you fashion from it an arrow, an ice arrow, all right, with a very sharp point.
Yep
And you get yourself a bow, right, and you fire that ice arrow, okay, across the street, through the window, into the heart of the person you want to murder, right.
Right
Killing them. Instantly,
Yeah

They stumble to the ground, and then the ice arrow melts. Gervais, murder weapon? It's gone. Gone into the thin air. The wet patch dries. All right? The police arrive. They can't find the murder weapon. Safe.
This bow, is this made of ice?
Well, the bow see that all that is, is a bit of a wooden string.
Nevertheless, it is a bow, isn't it?
That could be anybody's bow.
Yeah, but then if you bludgen them to death just with a hammer, it could be anyone's hammer. Nevertheless, the fingerprints possibly will still be on the bow.
But the ice arrow is melting.
Oh, yeah, right. So what they do is they'll probably find you wandering around with a bow, look at this bloke that you didn't like. Yeah. They have a motive because you presumably didn't like them.
I didn't.
Then they'll see a little hole in his heart with some water.
No, it's dried.
Dried out has it?
Waters dried. So that's what makes it the perfect murder, because the ice has melted and dried.
Brilliant.
That is brilliant.
Okay.
It's incredible. Basically, there's not one hole in that plan.
No. Do you have to conveniently find somewhere that has got a flat to let opposite him as well?
Well, well. That is the perfect murder.
Right okay. Presumably, you've only got one ice arrow?
Just the one.
Right.
You only need one.
You've been practicing, presumably with, like, other arrows to get your shot just right. Just these walks in front of the window, you can release this fatal arrow of ice.
Are you mocking my plan?
No, it's good.
Are you mocking that?
And this is Mud Honey. We'll talk about this after.
Night of the Haunted - Mud Honey
Night of the Haunted by Mud Honey on XFM 104 point, what is it?
*groans*
9, yeah it's 9?
104 point 9, yeah
Yeah. Where do you make the ice arrow?
Well you
You can do that in your living room or your kitchen.
So you get-What do you do?
Do you have a mold or do you carve it out of a big block of ice?
I think you just
Chip away a big block of ice unti-
Where do you get that from?
Well you can buy big blocks of ice I'd expect.
Yeah. Okay. But no, um, you haven't left a trail of like, no one's followed you home or-
God, no.
I've been very careful.
What do you say, what do you say you're using it for? I'm a sculptor.
I'm an ice sculptor. Absolutely. You don't need a license for that. Like you would with a gun.
No, no, no.
You see, it's fail safe, this plan.
It is pretty good. I'm thinking along the same lines as that.
Are you?
Yeah. An ice hammer.
An ice hammer. Brilliant.
You just walk over, ring the doorbell, go, *bang, bang, bang* and then leave the hammer near the fire.
Brilliant.
Yeah.
And it melts and then the water dries. Fantastic. You see, what you've realized is that my plan is fail safe and you just got yourself a variation on it there. But it's brilliant.
Yeah. I'll be honest, I'm being a bit sarcastic. I think it's a stupid idea. It would never work. You're an idiot. 01715802000. Can we have some proper perfect murders, please?
01715802000, your perfect murders. Or *laugh* they could fax us. The perfect fax. Zero 171-580-1234. I think we should give away a pair of those embraced wristbands to the perfect murder.
Yeah.
The best perfect murder.
I made up the fax machine and there was no fax at all, but just a puddle of water by it.
Suspicious.
Yeah. After this break, Oasis.
ALLLLLLLLLL ABOARRRRRDDDDD, HAHAHAHAHAHA

This year at OZFEST. You can see Ozzy Osbourne, the original with Black Sabbath, Foo Fighters, Korn, Pantera, Soulfly, Prayer and more. Ozfest. Saturday the 20th of June at the Milton Kings Bowl. Tickets available now. The usual outlets are called 801 three eight, double eight, double four, AusPest heavy metal for people who enjoy audio decapitation.
World cup tickets bought and sold. World cup ticket sold for all the big games.

Listen. Tomorrow's Guardian, you can play the all new fantasy league game for the World Cup. It's called tickets out 98. And it works like this. You get ten grand to buy fantasy tickets to see every match of up to eight countries of your choice. The idea is to pick the sides while playing the highest scoring games using your expert selection skills. Then the people with the most goals could win fabulous football holidays to Brazil and Italy. So if their tickets out 98 only in the Guardian. Last chance tomorrow.
This.
You got a few quid. It's the closest you'll get to real tickets. Boy mate. World cup tickets.
This is the coolest day this summer because the hottest movies are half price. National Cinema Day. Don't miss out. Get down to your local participating cinema.
104 Point Nine.
Nirvana on a plane before that Oasis. And some might say
Beautiful
On XFM. 104 Nine. I was listening to Capital the other day.
- Capital, the other day.
Oh, it's
Fantastic station.
Great station.
You know it plays the hits from the seventies, eighties and nineties.
Well it did actually play one, and it reminds me of a story. Remember last week you were talking about you were bullied at school by Lionel Richie.
It was a nightmare.
I know.
Yeah, it was a big blow. And I was bizarrely bullied by Hanson.
Odd.
*Ricky laughs* Strange. Yeah. I went to school with another Mega pop star.
You didn't.
Yeah, yeah, yeah.
What're the odds of that!
Yeah, I know. It's amazing. Um, but he wasn't, I didn't get into fights, he didn't bully me, but I found out, in retrospect, he was nicking on my ideas.
I can't believe it.
Yeah.
Who was it?
It was Paul Simon.
Well, Simon, he's got reputation.
Oh yeah.
I'm not surprised.
But I mean, I wrote this song when we were in music class and it was called 'Lots Of Ways To Leave a Lover'.
Sounds familiar.

Yeah, well, the one they played on Capital was 50 Ways to Leave a Lover. And I listened, and went, hold on and it goes you um. Just slip out the back, Jack. Make a new plan, Stan. You don't need to be coy, Roy. Right? He's rhyming a name with a way of leaving your lover.
Right. Yeah.
I'll show you mine, you'll see the similarity. You tap on the bus, Gus. You don't need to discuss much. Just drop off the key Lee and set yourself free. Now, I had one like run away, Jose.
Right, clever.

Tell her you'd like to end the relationship, Philip. But I mean, you can see the pattern. And there's one I had, she should find a man who really loves her and live with him, Tim. Right? You know what I mean?
He hasn't improved on it.
No.
Has he.
He's probably made it a little bit snappier.
A bit snappier?

I mean, my favourite one was just sit down and say, look, I don't think you're my ideal life partner. And although we've had a good time, I really don't think we should marry, Barry. You know, and he's all he's done. He's put in a pop format.
And he's sold millions of copies.
So I think I'm going to play his own game.
Cut off your todger, Roger. Cut off your nob, Bob. Cut off your dick, Rick, you know what I mean?
Yeah, yeah.
Slice off your willie, Billy.
That'll do it, that'll do it.
Uhm, uhm, uh... Cut off your John Thomas.... John Thomas.
*Ricky laughs* Yeah, that works. That works. That one's like get off with her mate, Nate, that'll do it. French kiss her dad, Brad.
Nice. See someone else... Elsie.
Doesn't work, does it? Tell her you're gay, Ray?
Tell her you're gay, Ray.
Yeah that one *mumble* I wasn't prepared to give Hank any advice.
*Steve laughs* Forget about Hank.

This is Ian Camfield. London's only rock show is on XFM every Sunday between eight and ten. From Marylin Manson to Motorhead, Paradise Lost to Prodigy. Black Sabbath to Machine Head. There's 2 hours of it with competitions, guests and Metalhammer News sunday nights from eight to 10:00 p.m.. The rock show is only on 104.9 XFM.
What's your favourite movie?
Alright, love. I was only asking. Whatever it is, see it today. It's National Cinema Day. Tickets have been slashed to half price.

Hello, I'm Hazel. And I'm blanche. And we are the Lilt ladies. Guess what you're going to do today? We're going to dance in your car. If you're stuck in a jam, you've got a jam yourself. Don't just sit in the car there, get stuck. Come on we're dancing. Come on. Shake that shoulder. Go on rock it. Groove it. Rock it baby. Show me what you can do. You're not shy, are you? Get yourself a can of cool Lilt. Come on, wave those arms. Come on. Make sure you're opening the sunroof first. This little bit of sunshine was brought to you by Lilt. Totally tropical, totally chill.
Scott Four - Your Kingdom to Dust
Well, so that's obviously Scott Four, Your Kingdom to Dust
Don't lie to meet Gervais. Is that who it was?
Yeah, it's Scott Four.
Thank God for that. Gervais I'm a little bit concerned because we've had an awful big response to our perfect murder appeal.
Yeah,
Erm, you know normally we say things like, "phone in if you want money for free". Nobody phones in.
No...
You mentioned murder, that the lines start you know - red hot.
I think it's the type of listener that we attract.
Yeah, but it worries me slightly. It's all we've had two which are exactly the same suggestion. Darren from uh-
Now that is suspicious.
Well, exactly. Darren from Car Shelton, if that's a real place, I have no idea. And Sarah in Bickley have both come up with the idea of buying a leg of lamb. All right? Freezing it.
I like it already.
Well, it's got lamb involved. It's got exciting. Well, I think Darren was pork and Sarah was lamb. Fair enough.
Something in that isn't there.

Anyway, you freeze your leg of lamb or your leg of pork, you use it as a club, basically beat someone to death with it. And then, of course, you cook up your leg of lamb or pork and serve it to the investigating police officers, you see. Rather cheekily. And of course, evidence of the murder weapon has disappeared.
I li- I- Well, yeah, but then there'd be, like, bones and stuff and evidence cooking. What I do is then surgically put it back on the sheep.
Right. Slightly more ambitious, that one.
I know, but these days all right.
Another one here, keeping with the ice theme. Remember my ice idea?
Yeah, it's a great idea.

Well, the perfect murder would, in fact, be to freeze the feet of the victim, all right? By placing him in water. The ice, having a lower gravity than the water, would keep the victim's feet at the top and the head below water level. That I'm bored...
Would they be in on this, then? I assume this person wants to be murdered and therefore would allow you to put his feet in a fridge for 42 minutes.
I'm not sure how that one works, but anyway, it ends up with him appearing to have drowned, which brilliant. I mean, I admire that. It's a little bit too technical for me.
And all he's got to show for it is cold feet.

Particularly ambitious one from Greg in Harrow. He suggests, Gervais, that you invite the person you want to murder. All right? On a little outing, okay? You go out on a very hot day. You take a stroll in Regents Park, all right? You suggest to the person that perhaps your sunbathe for a while, okay? They strip off, you say, so I just cover you in sun tan lotion. They say fair enough. You wait for them to fall asleep, then you sprinkle crushed biscuits over their body and wait for squirrels to attack and bite and nibble them to death. Little bit ambitious.
Well, this will be the well known biscuit and flesh eating squirrel of old Regents Park.
Exactly.
I've had the biscuit. I may as well keep going. A lovely little layer of ombre solair there as well. Like a little human trifle. It's perfect.
It's a three course meal for any vampire squirrel. That's brilliant that is, yeah.
Yeah, well, actually, I still like that. I still like Greg's suggestions.
It's a great suggestion.
I'm going to give Greg a pair of these embrace wristbands if you'd like them. Now-

They say the proof of the killing is in the eating. I'd like to see this proved possible first, then we can give him a pair of eyes. So if you find a body and some fat squirrels with blood dripping and some crumbs on their coats, then you can have them. Go on and give them to him.

Yeah, so, Greg, you need to come down between eight and ten this evening if you want these tickets. Bring along a friend if you want. And what's his name here, weill attach some wristbands to you. They have to be surgically attached to you, apparently.
Yeah.
Anyway, perhaps give us another ring and what's his name can explain it all to you. But anyway, you're welcome. Greg.
We've got four more pairs to give away.
Have we?
And it's not as complicated as that.
Right.
It's the first four people to phone up and say, "I'll come". 8171-580-2000.
And they've got to say...?
"I'll come, uh yeah I'll come along"
They'll need it.
Sorry about little girl was on the beach. She was nice. XFM.
